item.title: Android Insecure Data Storage
item.description: Android apps usually store data locally on these places: Shared preferences SQLite databases Internal storage External storage Shared preferences The shared preferences are stored in an XML file. They are stored in the app’s data folder under the shared_prefs folder. SQLite databases SQLite databases are relational files that use a single file for storing data. The SQLite are suited for storing structured data on mobile. The database is only accessible to the app and not outside.
